episodeTitle: Secret of the Royal Family! The Ancient Weapon, Pluton
description: Crocodile reveals his plan to obtain the ancient weapon Pluton and sets a bomb to detonate in Palace Square. Meanwhile, Nami defeats Miss Doublefinger using her Clima-Tact's Tornado Tempo, and Zoro begins his battle against the steel-bodied Mr. 1.

events.title: Pluton's Existence Revealed
events.description: Crocodile reveals the existence of Pluton, an ancient weapon capable of destroying entire islands without a trace. He explains that he knows this secret is passed down through the royal family of Arabasta and demands King Cobra tell him its location.
events.significance: First major reveal of one of the three Ancient Weapons that will become central to the overarching One Piece narrative. This establishes the historical significance of Arabasta and the Nefertari family's role as protectors of ancient secrets.

quotes.text: Pluton... an ancient weapon strong enough to destroy an entire island without a trace.
quotes.speaker: Crocodile
quotes.context: Crocodile explaining Pluton's destructive power to Cobra

events.title: Crocodile Reveals Bomb Plot
events.description: Crocodile reveals his contingency plan: a massive bomb planted in Palace Square set to detonate at 4:30 PM, killing both the rebel army and the royal guard. He tells Vivi and Cobra they have only one and a half hours to stop it.
events.significance: Escalates the Arabasta conflict to a critical level, adding a ticking clock element to the arc. Shows Crocodile's ruthlessness and willingness to sacrifice thousands to achieve his goals.

quotes.text: At 4:30, one and a half hours from now, a bomb will explode in Palace Square.
quotes.speaker: Crocodile
quotes.context: Crocodile revealing his backup plan to ensure chaos in Arabasta

events.title: Nami's Rain Tempo
events.description: Nami demonstrates her Clima-Tact's Rain Tempo ability during her battle with Miss Doublefinger, creating actual rain using Cool Balls and understanding the weather manipulation capabilities of her weapon.
events.significance: Shows Nami learning to master the Clima-Tact's weather abilities and transitioning from a non-combatant to a capable fighter. Demonstrates Usopp's genius in creating the weapon.

events.title: Miss Doublefinger's Sea Urchin Stinger
events.description: Miss Doublefinger uses her Toge Toge no Mi devil fruit powers to create spikes all over her body in a sea urchin formation, attacking Nami with her Sea Urchin Stinger technique.
events.significance: Demonstrates the full combat capabilities of the Toge Toge no Mi and establishes Miss Doublefinger as a formidable opponent for Nami.

events.title: Miss Doublefinger's Toge Toge Doping
events.description: Miss Doublefinger activates Toge Toge Doping, enhancing her physical abilities by growing spikes inside her body to stimulate her muscles, making her stronger and faster.
events.significance: Shows the creative application of the Toge Toge no Mi beyond simple offensive spikes, using it for self-enhancement.

events.title: Nami's Mirage Tempo
events.description: Nami uses her Clima-Tact to manipulate the humidity and create illusions of herself, confusing Miss Doublefinger with the Mirage Tempo technique.
events.significance: Demonstrates Nami's growing tactical intelligence in combat and her understanding of weather manipulation for strategic purposes.

events.title: Nami's Thunderbolt Tempo
events.description: Nami creates a small thundercloud by combining Heat and Cool Balls, then electrifies it with a Thunder Ball to create the Thunderbolt Tempo, shocking Miss Doublefinger with a powerful electric attack.
events.significance: First use of Nami's offensive electric attack, showing her mastery of the Clima-Tact's combat functions and her growth as a fighter. This technique becomes a staple of Nami's fighting style.

quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami unleashing her first major offensive weather attack

events.title: Miss Doublefinger's Stinger Flail
events.description: Miss Doublefinger transforms her arms into spiked flails and wildly swings them at Nami in a devastating area attack called Stinger Flail.
events.significance: Shows the offensive versatility of the Toge Toge no Mi and Miss Doublefinger's combat experience.

events.title: Nami's Tornado Tempo Defeats Miss Doublefinger
events.description: Nami reads Usopp's instructions and activates the Clima-Tact's ultimate attack, Tornado Tempo. Initially appearing as harmless toy doves, the attack suddenly transforms into a violent tornado that launches Miss Doublefinger through multiple buildings, ending the battle in Nami's victory.
events.significance: Nami's first major solo victory against a powerful opponent, proving her worth as a combatant. The Tornado Tempo becomes one of Nami's signature finishing moves. This victory also demonstrates Nami's determination to help Vivi save her country.

quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami unleashing her ultimate Clima-Tact attack to defeat Miss Doublefinger

events.title: Nami Defeats Miss Doublefinger
events.description: Miss Doublefinger is left unconscious and defeated after the Tornado Tempo attack. Nami collapses from exhaustion and injuries but has successfully won her first major battle, eliminating one of Baroque Works' top agents.
events.significance: Marks Nami's evolution from a non-combatant navigator to a capable fighter willing to risk her life for her friends. Shows her dedication to helping Vivi and the Straw Hat Pirates.

events.title: Zoro vs Mr. 1 Begins
events.description: Zoro encounters Mr. 1 (Daz Bones) and begins their battle. Zoro immediately recognizes that his opponent's body is made of steel due to the Supa Supa no Mi devil fruit, presenting a unique challenge for a swordsman.
events.significance: Sets up one of the most important fights in the Arabasta arc, which will lead to Zoro learning to cut steel and advancing his swordsmanship to the next level.

events.title: Zoro's Ushi Bari
events.description: Zoro uses his three-sword style technique Ushi Bari (Bull Needles) against Mr. 1, but the attack proves ineffective against his steel body.
events.significance: Demonstrates the challenge Zoro faces in cutting steel and foreshadows his need to evolve his abilities during this fight.

events.title: Mr. 1's Spider
events.description: Mr. 1 transforms his fingers into blades and attacks Zoro with his Spider technique, demonstrating the offensive capabilities of the Supa Supa no Mi.
events.significance: Establishes Mr. 1 as a formidable opponent whose entire body can become bladed weapons, making him a dangerous close-combat fighter.

events.title: Crocodile Seeks the Poneglyph
events.description: Crocodile reveals that his true goal is to find the Poneglyph hidden in Arabasta, which contains information about Pluton's location. He forces King Cobra to lead him to it, with Nico Robin accompanying them.
events.significance: Establishes the importance of Poneglyphs in finding the Ancient Weapons and reveals Crocodile's ultimate plan. This connects to the larger One Piece narrative about the Void Century and ancient history. Also sets up Robin's role as the only person who can read Poneglyphs.

quotes.text: Pluton... an ancient weapon strong enough to destroy an entire island without a trace.
quotes.speaker: Crocodile

quotes.text: At 4:30, one and a half hours from now, a bomb will explode in Palace Square.
quotes.speaker: Crocodile
Nami
quotes.context: Using her first major offensive Clima-Tact attack

quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Unleashing the ultimate Clima-Tact attack to defeat Miss Doublefinger

themes.description: Crocodile's pursuit of Pluton demonstrates how ambition for power can drive people to extreme measures, willing to sacrifice thousands of lives to achieve their goals.
themes.symbolism: Pluton represents ultimate destructive power and how the desire for such power can corrupt.

themes.description: Nami's victory over Miss Doublefinger shows her growth from a non-combatant to a capable fighter, proving that dedication and intelligence can overcome physical disadvantages.
themes.symbolism: The Clima-Tact represents how Nami uses her knowledge and wit rather than brute strength to achieve victory.

themes.description: The revelation of Pluton and the Poneglyphs emphasizes the importance of ancient history and the burden of protecting dangerous knowledge across generations.
themes.symbolism: The Nefertari family's role as guardians of Pluton's secret represents the responsibility that comes with knowledge of dangerous power.

characterSpotlights.development: Nami demonstrates her growth as a fighter, mastering the Clima-Tact and defeating a powerful Baroque Works agent. Despite being injured and outmatched physically, she uses her intelligence and determination to achieve victory.
keyActions: Defeats Miss Doublefinger with Tornado Tempo
Shows unwavering determination to help Vivi

characterSpotlights.development: Crocodile reveals his true ambitions and the full scope of his plan, establishing himself as a ruthless villain willing to sacrifice an entire nation for power. His knowledge of ancient weapons and the Poneglyphs shows his sophistication as an antagonist.
keyActions: Reveals Pluton's existence to Cobra and Vivi
Explains the bomb plot in Palace Square
Demands to be taken to the Poneglyph
Demonstrates his willingness to kill thousands for his goals
quotes: Pluton... an ancient weapon strong enough to destroy an entire island without a trace.
At 4:30, one and a half hours from now, a bomb will explode in Palace Square.

characterSpotlights.development: Zoro begins his battle with Mr. 1, facing the challenge of cutting steel for the first time. This sets up his growth as a swordsman.
keyActions: Recognizes the challenge of fighting a steel-bodied opponent
Begins the battle that will lead to his evolution

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends Nami's battle with Miss Doublefinger with additional combat sequences and technique demonstrations not present in the manga.

trivia.fact: This is the final episode to feature the ending theme 'GLORY ~Kimi ga Iru Kara~' by Takako Uehara.
The Tornado Tempo technique is designed as a 'hit-or-miss' last resort attack according to Usopp's instructions, making its successful use against Miss Doublefinger particularly significant.
Episode 118 had a TV rating of 14.1%, ranking 3rd in its time slot when it aired in Japan.
This episode adapts content from manga chapters 192-193, both from Volume 21.
